_v.en: Nun. By the Pen and what they write:
by your Lord’s blessing, you are not, crazy,
and yours indeed will be an everlasting reward,
and indeed you possess a great character.
You will see and they will see,
which one of you is crazy.

_v.ar: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِمَن ضَلَّ عَن سَبِيلِهِۦ وَهُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِٱلْمُهْتَدِينَ
_v.en: Indeed your Lord knows best those who stray from His way, and He knows best those who are guided.
So do not obey the deniers,
who are eager that you should be flexible, so that they [too] may be flexible [towards you].
And do not obey any vile swearer,
scandal-monger, talebearer,
hinderer of all good, sinful transgressor,
callous and, on top of that, baseborn
—[who behaves in such a manner only] because he has wealth and children.

_v.ar: إِذَا تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِ ءَايَـٰتُنَا قَالَ أَسَـٰطِيرُ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
_v.en: When Our signs are recited to him, he says, ‘Myths of the ancients!’
Soon We shall brand him on his snout.

_v.ar: إِنَّا بَلَوْنَـٰهُمْ كَمَا بَلَوْنَآ أَصْحَـٰبَ ٱلْجَنَّةِ إِذْ أَقْسَمُوا۟ لَيَصْرِمُنَّهَا مُصْبِحِينَ
_v.en: Indeed we have tested them just as We tested the People of the Garden when they vowed they would gather its fruit at dawn,
and they did not make any exception.

_v.ar: فَطَافَ عَلَيْهَا طَآئِفٌ مِّن رَّبِّكَ وَهُمْ نَآئِمُونَ
_v.en: Then, a visitation from your Lord visited it while they were asleep.
So, by dawn it was like a harvested field.
At dawn they called out to one another,

_v.ar: أَنِ ٱغْدُوا۟ عَلَىٰ حَرْثِكُمْ إِن كُنتُمْ صَـٰرِمِينَ
_v.en: ‘Get off early to your field if you have to gather [the fruits].’
So off they went, murmuring to one another:

_v.ar: أَن لَّا يَدْخُلَنَّهَا ٱلْيَوْمَ عَلَيْكُم مِّسْكِينٌ
_v.en: ‘Today no needy man shall come to you in it.’
And they set out at early morning, [considering themselves] able to deprive [the poor of its fruit].
But when they saw it, they said, ‘We have indeed lost our way!’
‘No, it is we who have been deprived!’

_v.ar: قَالَ أَوْسَطُهُمْ أَلَمْ أَقُل لَّكُمْ لَوْلَا تُسَبِّحُونَ
_v.en: The most upright among them said, ‘Did I not tell you, ‘‘Why do you not glorify [Allah]?’’ ’

_v.ar: قَالُوا۟ سُبْحَـٰنَ رَبِّنَآ إِنَّا كُنَّا ظَـٰلِمِينَ
_v.en: They said, ‘Immaculate is our Lord! We have indeed been wrongdoers!’
Then they turned to one another, blaming each other.
They said, ‘Woe to us! Indeed, we have been rebellious.

_v.ar: عَسَىٰ رَبُّنَآ أَن يُبْدِلَنَا خَيْرًا مِّنْهَآ إِنَّآ إِلَىٰ رَبِّنَا رَٰغِبُونَ
_v.en: Maybe our Lord will give us a better one in its place. Indeed we earnestly beseech our Lord.’

_v.ar: كَذَٰلِكَ ٱلْعَذَابُ ۖ وَلَعَذَابُ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ أَكْبَرُ ۚ لَوْ كَانُوا۟ يَعْلَمُونَ
_v.en: Such was their punishment; and the punishment of the Hereafter is surely greater, had they known.

_v.ar: إِنَّ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ عِندَ رَبِّهِمْ جَنَّـٰتِ ٱلنَّعِيمِ
_v.en: Indeed for the Godwary there will be gardens of bliss near their Lord.
Shall We treat those who submit [to Us] as [We treat] the guilty?
What is the matter with you? How do you judge!
Do you possess a scripture in which you read
that you shall have in it whatever you choose?

_v.ar: أَمْ لَكُمْ أَيْمَـٰنٌ عَلَيْنَا بَـٰلِغَةٌ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ ۙ إِنَّ لَكُمْ لَمَا تَحْكُمُونَ
_v.en: Do you have a pledge binding on Us until the Day of Resurrection, that you shall indeed have whatever you decide?
Ask them, which of them will aver [any of] that!

_v.ar: أَمْ لَهُمْ شُرَكَآءُ فَلْيَأْتُوا۟ بِشُرَكَآئِهِمْ إِن كَانُوا۟ صَـٰدِقِينَ
_v.en: Do they have any ‘partners’ [that they claim for Allah]? Then let them produce their partners, if they are truthful.

_v.ar: يَوْمَ يُكْشَفُ عَن سَاقٍ وَيُدْعَوْنَ إِلَى ٱلسُّجُودِ فَلَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ
_v.en: The day when the catastrophe occurs and they are summoned to prostrate themselves, they will not be able [to do it].

_v.ar: خَـٰشِعَةً أَبْصَـٰرُهُمْ تَرْهَقُهُمْ ذِلَّةٌ ۖ وَقَدْ كَانُوا۟ يُدْعَوْنَ إِلَى ٱلسُّجُودِ وَهُمْ سَـٰلِمُونَ
_v.en: With a humbled look [in their eyes], they will be overcast by abasement. Certainly, they were summoned to prostrate themselves while they were yet sound.

_v.ar: فَذَرْنِى وَمَن يُكَذِّبُ بِهَـٰذَا ٱلْحَدِيثِ ۖ سَنَسْتَدْرِجُهُم مِّنْ حَيْثُ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
_v.en: So leave Me with those who deny this discourse. We will draw them imperceptibly [into ruin], whence they do not know.
I will grant them respite, for My devising is indeed sure.

_v.ar: أَمْ تَسْـَٔلُهُمْ أَجْرًا فَهُم مِّن مَّغْرَمٍ مُّثْقَلُونَ
_v.en: Do you ask them for a reward, so that they are weighed down with debt?
Do they possess [access to] the Unseen, so that they write it down?

_v.ar: فَٱصْبِرْ لِحُكْمِ رَبِّكَ وَلَا تَكُن كَصَاحِبِ ٱلْحُوتِ إِذْ نَادَىٰ وَهُوَ مَكْظُومٌ
_v.en: So submit patiently to the judgement of your Lord, and do not be like the Man of the Fish who called out as he choked with grief.

_v.ar: لَّوْلَآ أَن تَدَٰرَكَهُۥ نِعْمَةٌ مِّن رَّبِّهِۦ لَنُبِذَ بِٱلْعَرَآءِ وَهُوَ مَذْمُومٌ
_v.en: Had it not been for a blessing that came to his rescue from his Lord, he would surely have been cast on the bare shore, being blameworthy.
So his Lord chose him and made him one of the righteous.

_v.ar: وَإِن يَكَادُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ لَيُزْلِقُونَكَ بِأَبْصَـٰرِهِمْ لَمَّا سَمِعُوا۟ ٱلذِّكْرَ وَيَقُولُونَ إِنَّهُۥ لَمَجْنُونٌ
_v.en: Indeed the faithless almost devour you with their eyes when they hear this Reminder, and they say, ‘He is indeed crazy.’
Yet it is just a reminder for all the nations.
